answers.answer: In this type of situation - I think you need an expert. someone you knows everything about hormones and especially pituitary issues.You don't want to rely on someone who doesn't know how to treat this.
So you think you would stay with the endo dr's until you find one that takes me serious and not mess around with the D.O.'s

I would get an expert, too.  My kids' ped is a D.O.  she is also board certified.  They are great, but as with any situation that requires a specialty, I'd go get one and then bounce the ideas off the DO as a 2nd opinion if you want.C~
Thanks for your input. It is nice to bounce it off of others

I agree. I go to a family practice with a DO and a PA. I love that they are so holidtically focused and trust them to manage my care especially since they sent me to an Endo when their expertise reached it's end with my thyroid issues. They did vitamin testing and helped me treat nutritional deficiences which has made the world of a difference.

I have a D.O. as my primary care provider, and he is just amazing. He was the one that found my thyroid cancer. However, when all was done, he did tell me that I should see a Endocrinologist. My D.O.stays in touch with my Endo to make sure that they're all on the same page. I'm not too thrilled with my Endo, however, I will be getting a new one real soon. Just waiting for my appointment.
